questions.question: 1. What is the time complexity of the Naive String Searching Algorithm? (N = length of the string, M = length of the pattern)

explanations.a: Correct. The naive string search checks each possible starting index in the string (O(N)), and for each, compares up to M characters (O(M)), resulting in O(N*M) time complexity.
explanations.b: Incorrect. O(N+M) is the complexity of more advanced algorithms like KMP.
explanations.c: Incorrect. O(N^M) is not the correct complexity for this algorithm.

explanations.a: Correct. The code implements the naive search algorithm and returns 1 if the pattern 'algo' is found in 'kmpalgo', which it is.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The pattern is present, so the output is not 0.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The code does not cause a runtime error.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The code does not have a compilation error.
